result.name: Interdisciplinary Studies B.A. Environmental Studies Concentration

templateAssets.content: Thank you for your interest in CSU Dominguez Hills! This articulation agreement displays lower-division course requirements specific to this major. Students are advised to meet with an academic counselor when planning to transfer to CSU Dominguez Hills and refer to the University Catalog to learn more about this major and its features. Detailed admissions requirements for transfer students are available on the CSUDH campus website. Completion of Statutory Requirements (United States History, Constitution and American Ideals) is a baccalaureate degree requirement for the California State University system and may be met prior to transfer with eligible California Community College (CCC) courses designated as US-1, US-2, and US-3. Completion of Statutory Requirements prior to transfer is most advantageous and strongly encouraged as a number of CCC courses that meet this requirement might also double-count for General Education.

Interdisciplinary Studies (IDS)/PACE offers major concentrations in four areas of study:


  • AMERICAN STUDIES focuses on the study of the United States through an examination of history, literature, sociology, and politics.
  • COMPARATIVE STUDIES focuses on an examination of world cultures from an interdisciplinary perspective.
  • ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES focuses on understanding the natural world and the implications of individual, community, and government actions on the environment.
  • GLOBAL STUDIES focuses on the critical knowledge of world political, economic, social, cultural, and ecological systems.


IDS is part of a national network of Programs for Accelerated College Education (PACE) that are designed for working, adult students who want to earn a bachelor’s degree in a reasonable period of time while they maintain a full-time job. While all admitted students are welcome, IDS/PACE students are primarily transfers who enter CSUDH with 60 units and junior-class standing. While an associate of arts degree before entering IDS/PACE is not necessary, students are advised to complete most lower division General Education requirements before transferring.


Applicants will qualify for admission to IDS/PACE if they have completed 60 transferable semester units, have a grade point average of "C" (2.0) or better and have completed the General Education Basic Skills courses (The "Golden Four," Speech, Composition, Critical Thinking, and a transferable math course) with grades of "C-" or better. The maximum number of transferable units from a community college is 70 semester units. Always check the University Catalog for current transfer requirements.


For additional information about the IDS program, please click here.
